dreisoft.tresos.generator.ng.api.ant

Class JavaGenContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • dreisoft.tresos.generator.ng.api.ant.JavaGenContext

  • public class JavaGenContext
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is handed to a IJavaGenTemplate or a Jet template.

    Copyright (C) Elektrobit Automotive GmbH - All rights reserved

    Since:
    2008.b

    • Method Detail

      • get

        public static JavaGenContext get(java.lang.Object argument,
                                 java.lang.StringBuffer stringBuffer)
                          throws java.io.IOException
        This method can be used within Jet templates to get a JavaGenContext from the parameters given to the Jet template. The method returns a JavaGenContext where the default GeneratorWriter is redirected to the StringBuffer of the Jet template. To get a JavaGenContext in a Jet template use the following code: 
         <% JavaGenContext context = JavaGenContext.get( argument, stringBuffer ); %>
        Parameters:
        argument - The parameter "argument" given to the generate() method of the Jet template
        stringBuffer - The "stringBuffer" variable of the Jet template
        Returns:
        A JavaGenContext.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        Since:
        2008.b

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
        Called by the Ant tasks to remove the arg. variables.
        Since:
        2008.b

      • getWriter

        public GeneratorWriter getWriter()
                          throws java.io.IOException
        Get the default writer. The default writer writes to the file settable via the file attribute of the calling Ant task. The file is stored in the CodeGeneratorContext variable "arg.file".
        Returns:
        The default generator writer.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        Since:
        2008.b
